tip: Use `:w` to save your file.
Use `:q` to quit Vim.
Press `u` to undo your last change.
Press `Ctrl+r` to redo an undone change.
Use `yy` to copy a line.
Use `dd` to delete a line.
Use `p` to paste after the cursor.
Use `P` to paste before the cursor.
Press `v` to enter visual mode and select text.
Press `Ctrl+v` to select a block of text (visual block mode).
Use `:set number` to display line numbers.
Use `:set relativenumber` to show relative line numbers.
Use `/text` to search for 'text' within the file.
Press `n` to go to the next search result.
Press `N` to go to the previous search result.
Use `:noh` to remove the search highlight.
Use `:split` to split the window horizontally.
Use `:vsplit` to split the window vertically.
Use `Ctrl+w h/j/k/l` to move between split windows.
Use `:e filename` to open a file.
Use `:wq` to save and quit Vim.
Use `:q!` to quit without saving.
Use `:x` to save and exit, similar to `:wq`.
Use `:tabs` to list all open tabs.
Use `gt` to switch to the next tab.
Use `gT` to switch to the previous tab.
Press `Ctrl+d` to scroll down by half a page.
Press `Ctrl+u` to scroll up by half a page.
Use `:help` to open the help system.
Use `:w filename` to save a file with a new name.
Use `:set tabstop=4` to set the tab width to 4 spaces.
Use `:set shiftwidth=4` to set the indentation width.
Use `:set expandtab` to insert spaces instead of tabs.
Press `Ctrl+f` to move forward one page in the file.
Press `Ctrl+b` to move backward one page in the file.
Use `:read filename` to insert the contents of another file.
Use `:!command` to run an external shell command.
Use `:%s/old/new/g` to replace all instances of 'old' with 'new'.
Use `:set list` to display hidden characters like tabs and newlines.
Use `:set noswapfile` to disable swap file creation.
Use `:b` to switch between buffers.
Use `:bnext` to go to the next buffer.
Use `:bprev` to go to the previous buffer.
Use `:silent` to suppress the output of a command.
Use `:%y+` to yank (copy) the entire file to the system clipboard.
Use `:read !command` to insert the output of a shell command.
Use `:set incsearch` for incremental search (search as you type).
Use `:set ignorecase` to make searches case-insensitive.
Use `:set smartcase` to make searches case-insensitive, unless uppercase letters are used.
Use `:set wrap` to enable text wrapping at the edge of the screen.
Use `:set nowrap` to disable text wrapping.
Use `:set listchars=tab:→ ,trail:·` to customize the display of tabs and trailing spaces. Make sure to escape your space after tab.
Press `Ctrl+w =` to make all splits equal in size.
Use `Ctrl+w q` to close the current split.
Use `:help :command` to look up help for a specific command.
Use `:set clipboard=unnamedplus` to use the system clipboard by default.
Use `:set number!` to toggle line numbers on and off.
Press `Ctrl+w T` to open a new tab page.
Use `:vs` to open a new vertical split window.
Use `:sp` to open a new horizontal split window.
Use `:max` to maximize the current split.
Use `:term` to open a terminal window inside Vim.
Use `Ctrl+z` to suspend Vim and return to the shell.
Use `:undo` to undo changes across multiple levels.
Use `:redraw!` to force a redraw of the screen.
Use `:set spell` to enable spell checking.
Use `]s` to jump to the next spelling error.
Use `[s` to jump to the previous spelling error.
Use `:set nohlsearch` to disable search highlighting.
Use `:set cursorline` to highlight the current line.
Use `:set cursorcolumn` to highlight the current column.
Press `Ctrl+o` to jump to the previous location in the jump list.
Press `Ctrl+i` to jump to the next location in the jump list.
Use `:file` to display the name of the current file.
Use `:mksession` to create a session file for restoring a workspace.
Use `:arglist` to list all files in the argument list.
Use `:next` to go to the next file in the argument list.
Use `:prev` to go to the previous file in the argument list.
Use `:argdo command` to run a command on all files in the argument list.
Use `:normal` to execute normal mode commands from the command line.
Press `Ctrl+w o` to close all other windows except the current one.
Use `:w !sudo tee %` to save a file as root.
Use `:tabnew filename` to open a file in a new tab.
Use `:tabclose` to close the current tab.
Use `:tabonly` to close all tabs except the current one.
Use `:set noswapfile` to disable the creation of swap files.
Use `:set backup` to enable backup files.
Use `:set writebackup` to allow backups to be written automatically.
Use `:set undofile` to enable persistent undo across sessions.
Use `:set background=dark` to set a dark background theme.
Use `:set background=light` to set a light background theme.
Use `:set termguicolors` to enable 24-bit color support.
Use `:syntax on` to enable syntax highlighting.
Use `:syntax off` to disable syntax highlighting.
Use `:set foldmethod=indent` to enable folding based on indentation.
Use `:set foldmethod=syntax` to fold code based on syntax.
Press `zc` to close a fold and `zo` to open it.
Use `:set foldenable` to enable folding.
Use `:set foldlevel=0` to start with all folds closed.
Use `:set foldlevel=99` to open all folds.
